reviews.text: We stayed at the Riu Varadero in Dec and we LOVED it! We travelled here with our family of four and another family of four, kids aged 4 to about 6 months and this resort suited our needs perfectly. We stayed in the Royal section and we were glad that we upgraded. The quieter pool and bigger rooms were worth it for us. We were very close to the Royal Pool , the beach , snack bar and the beach/seafood restaurant so it was a well situated room. Mind you, we didn't find the size of the resort to be a problem, it was nice to be able to walk around after dinner and everything seemed really well laid out.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed the RIU

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Beach was great, we never had a problem getting chairs or shade. Travelling with kids we were always up early and down at the beach or pool by 8, so that is probably why....people do reserve chairs , nothing you can do so I say if you cant beat them, join em!! Just don't wait till midday to try to get sun beds, there will be none left!
reviews.title: I am usually not a complainer

reviews.text: The rooms were nice, clean and big enough for our King bed, a roll-away bed for our eldest and a crib for our baby. We never felt cramped, which was nice. The bathroom was nice and big with both a tub and a shower. The maids were great, always making the room look nice and clean while we were out, and always keeping us well stocked with water and beer.
reviews.title: my first trip to veradero

reviews.text: The food and restaurants were really good, I am not sure what people have to complain about! I had read some reviews before we left and I was a little worried! It didn't take us long to realize that there was nothing to worry about.....
reviews.title: nice resort

reviews.text: We ate at the Buffet restaurant for breaky everyday and it was great! Omelette stations, croissants , sausages,bacon, pancakes....there was plenty to choose from and better options than I have seen at a lot of other Cuban resorts. We ate here for dinner only a few nights, but once again I found that there were enough options to keep me and the group I was travelling with happy. Most lunches we ate at the Royal snack bar, the burgers were so tasty! The beach restaurant was also great, again we found lots and lots of options.
reviews.title: Stay elsewhere

reviews.text: I have to say that this hotel was great. I really do not have anything negative to say because my family (6 years old and 4 years old) and a hubby had a great time. I was prepared to experience the hotel myself after reading all the reviews both postive and negative and you can say that my expectations were not high to begin with. But I was pleasantly surprised. We upgraded to the Royal section which is a must, especially in CUBA to at least get a 4-5 star stay. The staff were friendly, check in was smooth and the food was great. I have been to CUBA 4 times and I have never had so much seafood, lobster to boot!! The food in the Royal section a la carte restaurant was very good and the area was quiet and relaxing. The rooms are more modern then most of the other hotels in CUBA and I did not feel that damp feeling I usually do but then again it was not humid at the time. Towels & fridge were always stocked and the room generally was clean. The shows at night were entertaining. I would definitely return to this resort but will upgrade again because its worth it!
reviews.title: Great short get-away

reviews.text: Why do people constantly refer to TOWELS and complain of availability. You must own a computer and have read past reviews?? OK, well simply put, take the 10 dollars you will pay for a towel deposit down there and go to walmart, buy a beach towel. You can take it with you, I know right?? You will keep it the week and maybe even use it at home again and for trips to come...holy crow, you guys
reviews.title: TOWELS, Really????

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First I would like to say that Value for money this is a good choice. We paid $605 plus $280 tax each. We were upgraded to the Royal Section for free upon check in because they had overbooked and did not have a standard room with a king bed available. This was a nice surprise. We laughed when we saw our room because it certainly was not what we expected in the Royal Section but overall it was nice. Of course we had to push the two double beds together which was pretty funny. The Royal Restaraunt was very slow. We tried eating there a few times and the a la carte service took up to 45 minutes. The buffet they offered was good but had few choices. We enjoyed the main buffet more often and the omelettes were great. Many good choices at the buffet and the food was flavourful. I laughed when I saw the hot dog casserole.
reviews.title: Good hotel if you have little to compare it to

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a few bars but we found that they were very busy and slow to serve. It didnt seem to matter how much we tipped the bar tenders because the drinks were often made poorly and were not always enjoyable. I will say that the cigar lounge bar was our favourite which is in the Royal Section. It was never very busy, the girls working at the bar were very nice and made great drinks. The only downside about the cigar bar was the amount of people who thought it was ok to bring their children in. I never felt comfortable to enjoy a cigar while kids are in the same room.
reviews.title: Spectacular,Fantastic,Superb,Amazing,I could go on and on...

reviews.text: The beach was kept fairly clean. There was never a shortage of lounge chairs if you look you will find stacks of them off to the sides. The beach is very, very crowded we found. We were lucky to have 3 nice enough days to enjoy the beach. The weather is pretty unpredictable in January for Cuba.
reviews.title: It's a Five ( 5 ) Star for Cuba

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Came back a little over a week ago from a one week trip to the new Riu Varadero. I was compulsively reading reviews before going. Now that I am back, I can say, I had a great vacation!! Was everything perfect, no, of course not, nothing ever is, especially at a new resort, but was it anything that ruined my vacation or would make me not recommend the place? absolutely not! So here is my honest review.
reviews.title: Great vacation - here's the down low

reviews.text: HOTEL and GROUNDS - Oh my god, beautiful! I mean, the decor is beautiful, everything was clean, cannot fault them for anything there at all. Loved it! It is huge, so be prepared to do some walking, though they do have golf carts to bring you around if you'd like. We enjoyed the size.
reviews.title: Fun if you want it to be

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: ROOMS - loved our room! Prior to going I had written them an email requesting, if possible, to be in a building in the North section (the one closer to the beach) and was happy to see they had accomodated the request (or i just got lucky...) - the room was also ready when we got there at 2 pm even though check in was later. We were in block 22 and were very happy with it. It was close enough to the beach, but close also to the main pool, and the lobby and restaurants, perfect location for us. The room was spacious and very clean. The mini fridge was always stocked, we never ever had the water cut out, as some people experienced, and hot water all the time. The pressure in the shower is also excellent! Air conditioner worked very very well. Only tiny issue we had, was after day two or three, the winds were strong and our patio door, for some reason, would rattle. Pushing the coffee table against it helped some. So all in all, loed our room. Also, after the first day, my husband left the maid a little gift I had brought her. Now, not sure it was her, but we're guessing it was...but when we came back to our room, there were 12 extra beer on our balcony and a bottle of champagne!! :) Awesome! We enjoyed the champagne on the beach one night.
reviews.title: " BEST TIME EVER "

reviews.text: BEACH - Pretty good. We had lots of wind most of the time so lots of waves, and no rental of beach equipment. But the one day it wasnt windy, we rented the pedalboat and it was awesome!! There is barely any seaweed at all, beach is very clean in general. I do have to say it is not very deep. Its wide, ie, you can walk forever either way, but not very deep. Ohter thing is, there are not enough beach chairs for the amount of people. We walked by other hotels who had piles and piles of chairs. At Riu, every single chair was either in use, or had a towel/beach bag, to keep it reserved. SO I think they should invest in getting more chairs. I also think people should be more considerate. If you are leaving for longer than an hour, dont keep your stuff there and expect to have the chair all day. Share! Anyway, my husband and I just found two chairs that had a mere towel on it, we used it anyway, for over an hour, and when the lady came back, and said it was her chairs, we said "Yeah, we know, smiled and walked away" ;)
reviews.title: PERFRCT

reviews.text: POOLS - great - clean. could maybe use a few more chairs there too,but not too too bad. Pool bar is great too. Some animation days there were great, some days not much going on.
reviews.title: awsome place

reviews.text: I stayed at the Riu with my two children the week of Jan 2-9th. Check in was okay (we arrived around 10pm), but we were only given 2 tickets for beach towels and had to wait until the next morning to be allotted our 3rd ticket. Due to advisor's warnings, we kept the towels for a couple of days rather than handing them in each day. When we got to the room we found there was only 1 towel provided. I went back to the front desk (at 10:30pm) and requested 2 more towels to be sent up along with a facecloth ( a note about facecloths: I got my hands on one the 3rd day and made the mistake of hanging it up. It was removed and I never got another one despite requesting one each day from the front desk. I did tip the maid btw). At 1:15 am the maid knocked on the door and provided us with the two towels, no facecloth. No apologies for waking us up! We were placed in bungalow 15 on the 3rd floor. It is right next to the relax pool and fairly close to the buffets and restaurants. The room was okay, beds were hard but functional. Shower was fine except for one time during the morning rush where there was only a cold dribble. The beach is a bit of a walk. We had some cold days and the beach was empty. On the hot days the place was crazy. Practically no sand to be seen for the sea of chairs.
reviews.title: Nothing Special Here

reviews.text: The food is not great, that is okay, we had read enough reviews to be prepared. You can get fresh meat made during the dinner meal if you stand in line; it was tough, but fresh. Veggies are a hit and miss, you can see the same ones (and I really mean the same ones) for the next 3 meals. Morning meal you can stand in line for a fresh omelette, not great, but fresh. The eggs in the buffet are pretty sad. If you can get a hash brown you are lucky. People practically run to the buffet if the workers put in a pan, LOL! Desserts are okay, very pretty and fresh. Typically lots of ice cream with the special toppings for the kids.
reviews.title: notimpressed

reviews.text: We did experience a problem with electricity on our 3rd night. A fuse blew and the fire alarm was set off around 10. When we went to the front desk for information they told us it was all fixed at 10:30. We decided to sit in the lobby for a bit and headed back to the room for 11pm. It was not fixed! We walked back to the lobby and found another couple complaining about the same thing. They would not switch rooms and at 11:30 we decided to go to bed. We sorted ourselves out by the light of our IPODs and settled into bed. Electricity came on at 12:30am. We just dealt with it and decided not to make an issue. Calling the front desk is a joke, they will not speak English. It is easier to get the exercise and walk.
reviews.title: Very nice resort

reviews.text: Advice: If you want to eat at one of the "gourmet restaurants", look good, dress well, have a peso handy and stand in line the first morning of your trip. We stood in line for an hour to tell us that almost everything was booked by our second day. We got a reservation for our last night in the Creole restaurant. It was nothing to write home about.
reviews.title: Great resort clean and beautiful, people always happy and cheerful

reviews.text: If you do one of the Havana tours, make sure to take toilet paper or lots of peso's. There are women manning every washroom with an allotment of t-paper. There are no seats on the toilets, and no way of drying your hands when you wash them.
reviews.title: Worst trip ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is not a riu, it is more like a 18-30's. we stopped there for 3 weeks in November. We moved rooms three times, even put in the Royal club, the room was in need of decorating and the shower flooded the bath room.One day we had no wate rin the room for 8 hrs The food in the restaurants was horrible. The main pool was a disgrace with drunken people. There was no dress code, you go in the restaurants that you booked in swim shorts, caps and flip flops. The beach was full of sea weed and never cleaned.
reviews.title: The worst hotel we have stopped in

reviews.text: OK, if you like going to "big box store" resorts, this might be the one for you. My personal rule is never go to a place with more than 200 rooms and this one has maybe 1,000 according to my calcs.
reviews.title: Good For Some - Not So Good For Others

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Who Will Like It:
reviews.title: Great time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - if you're in your 20's or so and like to party like mad, smash things, and maybe get into a fight
reviews.title: royal junior suite

reviews.text: - if you like crowds, hanging out at a massive inside pool with no view of the beach, and eating snacks like crappy burgers and cold fries
reviews.title: 4 Star Resort

reviews.text: Eight of us stayed at the Riu Varadero from Jan 10-17. We came from all across Canada and met up at the resort and every one of us had a great experience. Yea there was the usual small problems that you find at every resort but all and all it was terrific. Clean, friendly and easy to get around. The food was great considering this is Cuba. You could always find something good to eat at the buffets. No problems with towels, always loungers at the pools so long as you got there early...and why not get there early? You get to spend the whole day in Paradise. We arrived back home to Ottawa then Pembroke in freezing rain and 30cm of snow. A good reality check! This is a great resort for the money.
reviews.title: Great resort for the money...

reviews.text: I stayed at the Riu Varadero from Jan 1, 2012 to Jan 7th, 2012. The Resort was clean and well maintained. The food is average, better than I was expecting. Our housekeeping ladies were amazing!!!!!Everday a creative new character was waiting for us made from our clothes, towells and blankets. The bar and snack bar staff were super friendy and just remember if you treat them good and with respect they will give it back to you 100 times over!!The Entertainment staff meaning the dancers and preformers are first class!!!!!! DO NOT LEAVE without catching one of their nightly shows, preferabley the Michale Jackson Show. These dancers work their butts off for your entertainment and it's FREE!!! Everything aside it was the Cuban people that made my vacation. These people are alive and happy and full of passion and life!!!!!They have NOTHING and yet they are the most giving people I have ever met!!!!!So really at the end of the day, who cares if you don't get to trade your towell in for a new one, who cares if your meal was not "high end" be thankful you can afford to go on a holiday with your friends and or family and that you actually get to eat and eat whenever you want!!! I loved it sooo much I have already re-book for this March!!!Can't wait!!!!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Best Hotel Ever!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Riu Varadero in Cuba on January 9 - 16, 2012 through Sunwing. I'm so glad that we upgraded to the Royal Club section of the resort. You had your own pool, hot tub, premium liquor and the International Restaurant (a la carte for breakfast, lunch and dinner). I ate lobster five times, it was so delicious and I drank champagne and orange juice every day. Our junior suite was very clean with a safe in the room, along with a partial view of the ocean. We didn't experience any issues with bugs, towels in our room or towels at the pool. There were lots of clean towels each and every day. You can make dinner reservations at the Royal Club for the International Restaurant for the entire week once your arrive. Also, for $100 Canadian you get $88 Cuban pescos. We visited downtown Varadero one day a 10 minute taxi ride for $15 pescos. The resort is about a 1/2 ride from the airport. I have stayed at many Riu resorts in Mexico, but this is a 4 star Riu resort in Cuba, part owned by Riu and the other part owned by the Cuban government. Unfortunately, upon my return home I was sick with travellers diarahar, no fun but it can happen anywhere. We tipped our maid every day and she was very appreciative and we were not bugged to tip for other services. We had great weather, delicious meals, great premium drinks and met nice people from London, ON, and Germany.
reviews.title: Upgrade to the Royal Club ...

reviews.text: Well, well, well...stayed from jan 9 to jan 16 2012. First the good things...The rooms are great, very spacious and clean. The bathroom are nice. The service is very good and the staff is amazing... The pools are beautiful....but cold...probably 79 degres...Lots of intertainment, disco is full with younger adults, the theatre is very nice with shows every night..it seats over 500 people easy.
reviews.title: A 3 and a half star resort rated 5 star by sunwing and RIU...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ok now the not so good things about the resort...Beds are very hard...The beach is small...water is not clear in that area unless there is no waves..thought the sand is nice and there is a lot of shade...Hard to get new towels at the pool...Now for the food...knowing that Cuba was not the best in that area...that's why i thought i was staying at a 5 star resort...but the food was more like 2 star...they can't cook anything at that resort...At the buffet...meat are way overcooked...they had lobster but they were overcooked...what a shame...they were hard and chewy..The pasta bar had no meat sauce only canned tomato soup and alfredo sauces...usually that pasta bar saves me but not there...everyone we talked too were not impressed with the food at all...The reservation restaurants were ok not more...
reviews.title: fun in the sun?

reviews.text: I was in Cuba last March and loved the Cuban people and the beaches, we stayed at the Riu for a week. I was in a horrific accident and had to spend time in a hospital after skydiving, we landed in trees. I realize it was a freak accident and that the Cuban people at the hospital did the best they could for me til I got home. The Riu and sunwing rep made several phone calls to the hospital and made promises that they would send a car to the hospital to pick me up and guess what, they phoned back and said catch a cab. I had a very bad broken arm and leg and several stitches, plus I was in shock. My husband had no shoes or shirt and we were out on a street trying to wave down a cab. Once we caught our 55 minute cab ride the Riu made my husband pack us up and move rooms. I was in a nightgown and could barely manage to move, we were flying out in 6 hours. Once I got home I spent a week in our hospital and 8 months off work. Sunwing nor Riu did anything really other than try to ignore me. The other tourists were horrified when they seen me get on the bus to the airport.There were 45 of us and everyone could not believe how I was treated. The Riu is deffinitely not a 5 star. As for management look for the little guy that looks like a bell boy, he is the manager and my husband watched in horror when he told the staff we had to move rooms. What a nightmare! If i could I would love to post pictures of the shape I was in. I never heard from anyone again except sunwing- sorry for your experience.
reviews.title: Read this before you book!

reviews.text: All I can saw was awesome
reviews.title: Awesome resort and awesome time. Clean and friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed the beach and the cleanliness of the resort. Towels were hard to find but I recommend bringing your own towel as we did
reviews.title: Gerry / Ottawa nov 25-dec 4

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dirk I must have see you there and maybe djb.. your posts a both right on, all I would like to say is that I was not impressed with the truck with the driver wearing a mask spraying I have no idea, but this big cloud comeing out of the tanks in the back must not be healthy so anyone with babies, small children or even adults may want to stay away or inquire what it is..
reviews.title: Nice place shame about the Club18-30 culture...

reviews.text: As for the party animals at the pool there was a wedding of 80 guests, I was not part of it but mingled with them as they were quite friendly.. We were all young once ..
reviews.title: Great Time, But Would Not Return

reviews.text: Stayed at the Riu from Nov. 28 to Dec5th. The room was nice & clean but slept for a week on a broken bed! Only small bath towels in the room and we did not have any beach towels all week, always the same story over and over again (problems with the laundry) Food: the buffet has no variety, the same things day after day. Most of the time the food was cold, slippery floor, a lady fell off the chair one day! I have been to Riu Cancun a few times before so my expectations for the Riu varadero were high however it was disappointing.
reviews.title: Nice resorte but...

reviews.text: My 3rd time to Cuba, first time in Varadero - Stayed for 10 days from Nov 9th - 25th. Overall, this is a beautiful resort. Very clean, nice rooms and beautiful grounds. Like many have stated, its a new resort and thus has to work out some kinks, like hot water, towel, and beach chair supply. But none of these things ruined our stay. Staff was amazing, great service especially @ the buffet and from the bell hops.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort - with minor hiccups

reviews.text: On a side note - Being honest the only thing that put a bit of a kink in our stay were the French travelers that tend to flood Cuba in great masses. The concept of a "line","waiting your turn", or tipping the staff, or just having common courtesy for other people seemed to be a foreign concept to them and this we found frustrating. Everyone we talked to at the resort greatly shared this same feeling and most had had their own personal negative experiences - like the elderly couple who was pushed off the sidewalk due to a group of french travelers who refused to move over and share the sidewalk. Like seriously, who does that? News flash - the world doesn't revolve around you - wait your turn and be patient and have some manners! Someone had to say it. However, this is not a reflection on Cuba or the resort as obviously they cannot be held responsible for the inconsiderate actions of some of their visitors.
reviews.title: Great time with friends, but would not recommend...

reviews.text: Positives - Awesome food / huge selection - best I have had in Cuba so if you don't like it here you wont like it anywhere in Cuba, great staff, beautiful grounds, great drink selection, pools
reviews.title: Had a good time with my family, but I wouldn't go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Negatives - Hot water & beach / room towel supply issues (not enough - most days couldn't get a replacement for towels), beach chairs (won't get one after 10AM), location to town is far - you are at the end of the peninsula (however the Varadero beach tour bus picks you up across the street from the resort)
reviews.title: Good hotel, but .....
